bill_title: revise certain provisions relating to the practice of dentistry and to dental corporations.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to revise certain provisions relating to the practice of dentistry and to dental corporations. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 36-6A be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: Any advertisement for the provision of dental services shall include a statement of the name of the person licensed pursuant to this chapter who is providing the services offered. In any print advertisement, the statement shall be clearly legible and in a print size that is equal to or larger than the size of the print used to advertise the service. In any audio advertisement, the statement shall be clearly audible in speech that is at a volume and pace equal to that of the advertisement. Section 2. That § 47-12-7 be amended to read: 47-12-7. No corporation shall open, operate, or maintain an establishment for any of the purposes set forth in § 47-12-1 without a certificate of registration from the State Board of Dentistry, hereinafter referred to as the board. Application for such registration shall be made to said the board in writing and shall contain the name and address of the corporation and such any other information as may be required by the board. The board may require any contract between a dental corporation and a person licensed pursuant to chapter 36-6A, including any personal services contract, to be filed with the board. Any contract filed pursuant to this section is confidential unless disclosure of the contract is authorized by the parties to the contract. Section 3. That § 47-12-8 be amended to read: 47-12-8. Upon receipt of an application under § 47-12-7, the State Board of Dentistry shall make an investigation of the corporation. If the board finds that the incorporators, officers, directors, and shareholders are each licensed pursuant to the Dental Practice Act and if no disciplinary action is pending before the board or any other dental licensing board or agency against any of them, and if it appears that the corporation will be conducted in compliance with law and the regulations of the board, the board shall may issue, upon payment of a registration fee of one hundred dollars, a certificate of registration which shall remain effective until January first following the date of such the registration. Section 4. That § 47-12-9 be amended to read: 47-12-9. The certificate of registration including a list of all shareholders, directors, and officers of the corporation and the city and state of residence of each shall be conspicuously posted upon the premises to which it is applicable.

action_log.status_text: First read in House and referred to
